text: Art Shay (March 31, 1922 – April 28, 2018) was an American photographer and writer. He was born in The Bronx, New York, but spent most of his life in Chicago. Shay's 2000 autobiography is titled Album for an Age: Unconventional Words and Pictures from the 20th Century. In 2002, the American Theater Company in Chicago staged Shay's autobiographical play, Where Have You Gone, Jimmy Stewart?, directed by Mike Nussbaum. Shay died in April 2018 at the age of 96 in Deerfield, Illinois from heart failure.Playboy illustrator Art Paul, 93, and photographer Art Shay, 96, have died — both giants of 20th century Chicago ==References== ==Other websites== *Page on Art Shay at About.com * Collection of links and reviews of Art Shay's work * Stephen Daiter Gallery, artist listing work of Art Shay * Report: Photographer Art Shay hired to document Corgan, Pumpkins * Photojournalist: Art Shay - WTTW - Aired February 10, 2010 Category:1922 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:American autobiographers Category:American photographers Category:Writers from New York City Category:Writers from Chicago
